sentences.english: Compassion for other living things is more important than pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 对其他生命的恻隐之心比自身的享乐来得重要。

sentences.english: "Forget what?" inquired the little prince, who already was sorry for him.
sentences.chinese: “忘却什么呢？”小王子动了恻隐之心。

sentences.english: He has sympattendinghy for ingl poor people.
sentences.chinese: 他对悉数的穷人有一颗恻隐之心。

sentences.english: Out of sympathy for the homeless children he gave them shelter for the night.
sentences.chinese: 他怀着恻隐之心，留那些无家可归的孩子过夜。

sentences.english: Study: Women give more to charity than men.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明，女人比男人更爱动恻隐之心。

sentences.english: It was an act of compassion that came straight from the heart.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种内心恻隐之心的直接表达。

sentences.english: Out of sympathy for the homeless children he give them shelter for the night.
sentences.chinese: 他怀着恻隐之心，留那些无家可归的孩子过夜。

sentences.english: It was Christmas and the judge was in a benevolentmood as he questioned the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 时值圣诞节，所以法官在审讯犯人时动了恻隐之心。
恻隐之心在她胸中起伏。

sentences.english: "Come, said he, "you must have a little pity.
sentences.chinese: “好啦，”他说，“大家应当有点恻隐心。

sentences.english: To have pity of its enemy, it is to be without pity for itself.
sentences.chinese: 对敌人怀恻隐之心就是对自己无怜悯之心。

sentences.english: If you haven't got charity in your heart, you have the worst kind of heart trouble.
sentences.chinese: 若你心中无恻隐慈善，你便患有最厉害的心病。

definition: to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
to take pity on/to feel sorry for
to take pity on/to feel tenderness toward
to bemoan the state of the universe and pity the fate of mankind
to have tender affection for/to love tenderly/to pamper sb
